text: meet malli he's an 8 year old Belgian
Malinois and a war hero today he's being
recognized with the highest award for

medal for his bravery in Afghanistan
where he helped clear a building overrun
by Taliban fighters a massive gun battle
ensued with coalition forces and Maddy
was sent in the head of the troops to
search for IDs and enemy fighters the
amount of noise the dust the smoke you

overloaded senses he was received blast

full recovery and the Ministry of
Defence says there's no doubt his work
in Afghanistan helped save lives
Britain's armed forces have some 500
dogs in a variety of roles from sniffing
out explosives to hunting down
insurgents despite the technological
advances in other aspects of the
military dogs it seems are irreplaceable
I think there's a long way to go before

detector it's very agile it can go in

actually they're very good for morale as
well Malley's now part of the k9

that animals can be heroes too I think

and yes it does raise that that role
that they play it is a vital role that
they play and I think what I see more

incredible bond between the handler and
the
in recent years the dickin medal has
been awarded almost exclusively to dogs
a sign of their continuing importance to
the modern military that when the medal
was created in the Second World War
among the other recipients were 32
pigeons four horses and a ship's cat
it's not entirely clear what Malley
